help.title: MC PLC Connection
help.description: Configuration node for establishing connections to MITSUBISHI PLCs using the MC Protocol over Ethernet.
help.name: Optional descriptive name for this connection configuration. If not specified, it will default to "host:port".
help.host: IP address of the target PLC. Must be a valid IPv4 address (e.g., 192.168.1.18).
help.port: TCP port number for MC Protocol communication. Common values:
help.portAlternative: Alternative port used by some models
help.portFx: Used by some FX series PLCs
help.protocol: Communication protocol type. Currently only TCP is supported. UDP support is planned for future releases.
help.frame1E: Older format, compatible with legacy systems
help.frame3E: Standard format, recommended for most applications
help.plcType: Target PLC series for optimal compatibility:
help.qSeries: Q00J, Q00, Q01, Q02(H), Q06H, Q12H, Q25H series
help.binary: More efficient, recommended for most applications
help.timeout: Connection and communication timeout in milliseconds. Recommended values:
help.supportedDesc: This connection configuration supports a wide range of MITSUBISHI PLCs:
help.ethernetModule: PLC must have an Ethernet communication module installed and configured
help.mcProtocolEnabled: MC Protocol must be enabled in the PLC's network configuration
help.networkConnectivity: Node-RED server must have network access to the PLC's IP address
help.firewallSettings: Ensure the specified port is not blocked by firewalls
help.installEthernet: Install and configure Ethernet module in PLC
help.setStaticIp: Set static IP address and subnet mask
help.enterIp: Enter PLC's IP address in Host field
help.matchPort: Match port number with PLC configuration
help.selectType: Select appropriate PLC type and frame format
help.testConnection: Test connection using MC Reads node
help.statusDesc: The connection status is indicated in nodes that use this configuration:
help.verifyIp: Verify PLC IP address and network connectivity
help.checkMcProtocol: Check if MC Protocol is enabled on PLC
help.ensurePort: Ensure port number matches PLC configuration
help.checkFirewall: Check firewall settings on both ends
help.checkDocumentation: Check PLC documentation for supported formats
help.checkAddresses: Check if addresses exist in PLC memory
help.useBinary: Use Binary mode for better performance
help.adjustTimeout: Adjust timeout based on network conditions
help.groupAddresses: Group consecutive addresses for batch reading
help.consider3E: Consider using 3E frame for modern PLCs
help.noBuiltinSecurity: MC Protocol provides no built-in security - use secure networks
help.implementSegmentation: Implement network segmentation for critical systems
